results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1960
results.brief_description: The Football Association Challenge Cup Final is one of Britain’s great sporting events of the year. The 1960 Final was played between Blackburn Rovers and Wolverhampton Wanderers. This film attempts to capture the atmosphere of this great event played at Wembley Stadium near London before a crowd of 100,000 spectators.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1954
results.brief_description: The Football Association Challenge Cup final, 1954, between Preston North End and West Bromwich Albion, played at the Empire Stadium, Wembley. Shows the huge crowds, highlights of the game, and the presentation of the Cup by Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother.

results.title: Ezra Pound: poets' poet
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities
results.brief_description: Uses historic photographs, early documentary footage and the poet’s own recollections to explore the life of Ezra Pound. Born in Idaho, he spent his boyhood in Philadelphia, before moving to England. Other aspects of his life covered in this film are his asociation in Paris in the 1920s with other expatriates, such as Joyce, Stein and Hemingway, and his love affair with Rapallo and Venice. Some of the moods evoked by Pound’s poetry are highlighted. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities

results.title: Ezra Jack Keats (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Cynthia Freitag
results.brief_description: This film introduces the personality and style of Ezra Jack Keats, Caldecott Medallist, author and illustrator of well-known picture books. It concludes with an iconographic film rendition of one of his books “A Letter to Amy”.

results.title: Eyes: their structure and care [B&W]
results.brief_description: A farsighted young boy visits an optometrist and learns about the importance of protecting his eyes. The optometrist reviews the structure of the eyes, explains how the optical system functions, and discusses the cause of myopia, hyperopia, and astigmatism. Describes the work of an optometrist, an ophthalmologist, and an optician.

results.title: Eyes that hear
results.creator_credit: Campus Film Productions, Lexington School for the Deaf and Nat Campus
results.brief_description: An introduction to the work being done in schools for the deaf in America. Shows how deaf children are given a thorough vocational training to assist them to become useful citizens.

results.title: Eyes and their care
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The structure, functioning, physiology and hygiene of the eyes are studied, the following in detail: learning how to judge distance; eye movements; light receptors; field of vision; night blindness; double vision; near and far sightedness; infections of and protection for the eyes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
